data.sentence: The word وَلَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to protect, save, preserve, ward off, guard against evil and calamity, be secure, take as a shield, regard the duty. muttaqii - one who guard against evil and against that which harms and injures and is regardful of his duty towards human beings and God.
data.sentence: The word تَتَّقُونَ comes from the root و ق ي and is associated with the meanings: to protect, save, preserve, ward off, guard against evil and calamity, be secure, take as a shield, regard the duty. muttaqii - one who guard against evil and against that which harms and injures and is regardful of his duty towards human beings and God.
The word عَنْ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: follow/went or walked behind/after, overtook, pursue/investigate/examine/hunt, sought/reach/obtain it, prosecute/sue (for right/due or blood-revenge), succession of one to another, consecutive/successive, follower, imitator, continue the same course, aid/assist/help, come with, obey, desire/demand.An appelation of each of the Kings of El-Yemen who posessed Himyer and Hadramowt, so called because they followed one another when one died, another took his place, followed him in his course of acting. It is said in a tradition to mean a particular King who was a believer, whose people were unbelievers.
data.sentence: The word تَتَّبِعُوا comes from the root ت ب ع and is associated with the meanings: follow/went or walked behind/after, overtook, pursue/investigate/examine/hunt, sought/reach/obtain it, prosecute/sue (for right/due or blood-revenge), succession of one to another, consecutive/successive, follower, imitator, continue the same course, aid/assist/help, come with, obey, desire/demand.An appelation of each of the Kings of El-Yemen who posessed Himyer and Hadramowt, so called because they followed one another when one died, another took his place, followed him in his course of acting. It is said in a tradition to mean a particular King who was a believer, whose people were unbelievers.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word مُسْتَقِيمًا comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: cause, reason, way/path/road, necessity, means of access, responsibility, method/manner, plea to allege.. fi sabil Allah - in the way of Allah, in the cause of Allah, to carry the message of Allah.. ibn al-sabil - traveller, way farer, forlorn traveller.. salsabil - It is made up of two words: sal (ask, enquire about) & sabil (way), salsala - easy, sweet, rapid flowing water. As if it meant 'Inquiring ask your Lord the way to that sweet, easy palatable and rapid flowing fountain'. It is the name of a fountain of heaven.
data.sentence: The word سَبِيلِهِ comes from the root س ب ل and is associated with the meanings: cause, reason, way/path/road, necessity, means of access, responsibility, method/manner, plea to allege.. fi sabil Allah - in the way of Allah, in the cause of Allah, to carry the message of Allah.. ibn al-sabil - traveller, way farer, forlorn traveller.. salsabil - It is made up of two words: sal (ask, enquire about) & sabil (way), salsala - easy, sweet, rapid flowing water. As if it meant 'Inquiring ask your Lord the way to that sweet, easy palatable and rapid flowing fountain'. It is the name of a fountain of heaven.

data.meanings: to join to, be joined, be contiguous, to have dense vegetation. wassa - to bequeath, recommend, order, command with wise counsel and sermon, charge, exhort, enjoin, make a will.
data.sentence: The word وَصَّاكُمْ comes from the root و ص ي and is associated with the meanings: to join to, be joined, be contiguous, to have dense vegetation. wassa - to bequeath, recommend, order, command with wise counsel and sermon, charge, exhort, enjoin, make a will.

data.meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.
data.sentence: The word صِرَاطِي comes from the root ص ر ط and is associated with the meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.

data.meanings: o separate/distinguish/divide/split/decide. farqun - the act of distinction or separating. fariq - who separates, discriminates. firqun - separate part, heap. firqatun - band of human beings. fariqun - part/portion, some party or band of human beings. furqan - criterion of right or wrong, draft, evidence or demonstration, a name of The Quran, aid, victory, argument, proof, dawn, distinction.. faraqa (vb. 2) to make a division or distinction, make a schism. tafriq - division, dissension.. faraqa (vb. 3) To quit, depart.. mutafarriqun - diverse, different. fariqa - to fear, be frightened, plunge in the wave, seek refuge in fear, succour. yafraqu - to be timid and afraid, appear in one's true colour, be cowardly, be ridden by fear.
data.sentence: The word فَتَفَرَّقَ comes from the root ف ر ق and is associated with the meanings: o separate/distinguish/divide/split/decide. farqun - the act of distinction or separating. fariq - who separates, discriminates. firqun - separate part, heap. firqatun - band of human beings. fariqun - part/portion, some party or band of human beings. furqan - criterion of right or wrong, draft, evidence or demonstration, a name of The Quran, aid, victory, argument, proof, dawn, distinction.. faraqa (vb. 2) to make a division or distinction, make a schism. tafriq - division, dissension.. faraqa (vb. 3) To quit, depart.. mutafarriqun - diverse, different. fariqa - to fear, be frightened, plunge in the wave, seek refuge in fear, succour. yafraqu - to be timid and afraid, appear in one's true colour, be cowardly, be ridden by fear.
